moves.1. e4: Another game from the 52nd Gameknot Tournament, Advanced Section, Round 2.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Qf6: A novice's response to the Ruy Lopez.  The Queen shouldn't come out this early, where it is prone to attck by White's minor pieces as they develop.
moves.4. Nc3: Heading straight for d5 to harass the Q
moves.4... Nge7 5. Bc4: Not quite sure what the motivation was for this.  Of course it aims at f7, which is always a good idea, and it supports the QN moving to d5 but I could have achieved that by 5. Bxc6 Nxc6 or, if Black recaptured on c6 with a pawn, left Black with doubled pawns.
moves.5... d6 6. d3: Prepares another line of attack on the Q
moves.7. Be3 Qg6: threatens g2 and, if White castles, ... Bh3, threatening a quick mate
moves.9... Qf6: which attacks the N in return
moves.10. Bxd4: reasoning that Black can't take both B and N at the same time
moves.12... Qf6: The third time that Black has moved his Q to f6.  He's now well behind in development.
moves.13. Qg3 b5 14. Bb3 a5 15. a4 b4 16. Ne2: Black's series of pawn moves has inconvenienced White's minor pieces and gained him space on the Q-side but done little for his development.  Now White hits the point of Black's phalanx and makes room for his B
moves.17... Ba6: Black's B joins the fray, attacking the newly weak d-pawn
moves.18. Rad1: White completes his development while defending the d-pawn
moves.18... Nc6: finally freeing up the other B
moves.19. Bd5: pinning the N against the QR
moves.19... Rc8 20. f4: Threatening mayhem by taking on e5 and threatening the Q at the same time
moves.20... exf4 21. Bxf4 bxc3 22. bxc3 Qg6 23: ?  An over-optimistic miscalculation on my part
moves.25... Qxf7 26. Bxd6 Qxf1+ 27. Nxf1 Bxd6: The dust has cleared and, materially speaking, we're even: White has a Q and 2Ps (11 pts) for a R and 2Bs (11 pts)
moves.29. Ne3 Bc8 30. Qg6+ Kf8 31. Rf1+ Bf6 32: ? harassed by Black's army of minor pieces, I decide to sacrifice the exchange, leaving myself with an uphill struggle for several moves.  I had no plan for how I was going to force a win.  I should by rights have resigned after this but decided to persevere and see what turned up.
White's best chances seem to lie in threatening to promote the connected central passed pawns and maybe seizing an opportunity to fork Black's pieces with N or Q.  I started to feel more optimistic about my position.  Black should be looking to hit f1 or g2 with his Rooks for a quick mate and to stop the rampant pawns however he can..
moves.43. g3: not to threaten the N (it doesn't because it's pinned), just to avoid being taken
moves.43... Rg5: ? leaving the R on e7 undefended
moves.44. Qb6: threatening the B in order to gain time to fork K and R from d8
moves.44... Bxc4: The B had nowhere else to go
moves.45. Qd8+ Kh7: and Black didn't wait for 46. Qxe7+ with either a mating attack or further material gain with Nxc4 or Nf7+ and Nxg5.

gameName: The value of perseverance in the face of the odds
